The Spring Grove researchers also described the work of Canadian researchers Reginald Smart and F. Gordon Johnson as psychedelic chemotherapy. Like their counterparts in the United States, in the mid-1960s these researchers challenged the work of the early Canadian psychedelic therapy researchers by performing controlled trials of a treatment method that differed significantly from psychedelic therapy. As well as incorporating little or no psychotherapy, these researchers restrained their patients to their beds
